Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Rev. Cecilia B. Loving, Spiritual Leader, The Sacred Center
330 West 38th Street, New York, New York.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by  Speaker Quinn.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Rev. Cecelia B. Loving, Spirtual Leader, The Sacred Center, 330 West 38th Street, New York, N.Y.   

The Speaker (Council Member Quinn) moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of October 23, 2008 be adopted as printed by Council Member Gonzalez.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Gonzalez moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of October 23, 2008 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Katz
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application no. C 080502 PQM, an acquisition, shall be subject to Council review.  This application is related to application no. C 080501 HAM that is subject to Council review pursuant to Section 197-d of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: UDAAP, 148 West 143rd Street, Manhattan (C080502PQM)

Items.Title: Communication from the Speaker
Discussion of General Orders
Reports of Special Committees
Reports of Standing Committees

Resolution supporting the New York State Legislature’s consideration of legislative proposals intended to provide better workplace protections for domestic workers, and urging the vigorous enforcement of all current laws and regulations that provide such protections to such workers.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Domestic Workers’ Bill of Rights (A.628-A/S.5235)

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Economic Development

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the participation of minority-and women-owned business enterprises in construction projects related to properties receiving tax benefits in accordance with the industrial and commercial abatement program.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Participation of minority-and women-owned business enterprises in construction projects related to properties receiving tax benefits in accordance with the industrial and commercial abatement program.

Items.Title: Resolution approving a partial exemption from real property taxes for property located at  717, 719, 723 East 9th Street  (Block 379, Lots 53, 54, 56), Manhattan, pursuant to Section 422 of the Real Property Tax Law (Preconsidered L.U. No. 936).

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Land Use

Resolution approving the decision of the City Planning Commission on an application submitted by the Department of Housing Preservation and Development, ULURP No. C 080504 HAM, approving the designation of property located at 723, 719, and 717 East 9th Street (Block 379, Lots 53, 54 and 56), Borough of Manhattan, as an Urban Development Action Area, approving the project for the area as an Urban Development Action Area Project, and approving the disposition of such property to a developer selected by the Department of Housing Preservation and Development (L.U. No. 889; C 080504 HAM).
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: LU 889 - UDAAP, 723, 719, 717 East 9th Street, Manhattan (C080504HAM)

Items.MatterName: LU 933 - Zoning,  151-45 Sixth Road Whitestone Partners, LLC, Queens (C080204MMQ)

Items.Title: Resolution approving the decision of the City Planning Commission on ULURP No. C 080207 (A) ZSQ (L.U. No. 934), for modification pursuant to Section 2-06(c)(1) of the Uniform Land Use Review Procedure for the grant of a special permit pursuant to Section 78-312(f) of the Zoning Resolution of the City of New York to modify the distance between buildings requirements of Section 23-711 (Minimum Distance between Buildings on a single Zoning Lot) to facilitate the development of 52 1-family detached homes within a large-scale residential development on property located at 151-45 Sixth Road (Block 4531, Lots 79, 92; Block 4524, Lots 77, 92; Block 4487, Lots 160, 169, 170, 200; the bed of former 6th Road, and the bed of the proposed to be demapped portion of 152nd Street), in an R3-2 District, Borough of Queens.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: LU 934 - Zoning, 151-45 Sixth Road Whitestone Partners, LLC, Queens (C080207(A)ZSQ)

Brandt Road, Borough of Staten Island, Kim Magrone Courtney Place, Borough of Staten Island, Robert “Mr. Lou” Williams Way, Borough of Brooklyn, Marcus Garvey Square, Borough of the Bronx, Corporal Jonathan Rivadeneira Corner, Borough of Queens, Martin Gold Place, Borough of the Bronx, Michael Cotter Sr. Place, Borough of the Bronx, Larry Lusk Way, Borough of the Bronx, Syl Williamson Way, Borough of Brooklyn, Shirley Chisholm Place, Borough of Brooklyn, Dr. Susan Smith McKinney-Steward Place, Borough of Brooklyn, Damon S. Sanchez Corner, Borough of Brooklyn and renaming one thoroughfare in the Borough of Manhattan, River Terrace, and to amend the official map of the city of New York accordingly and the repeal of sections 12, 31, 32 and 38 of local law number 48 for the year 2008, section 59 of local law number 6 for the year 2003 and section 1 of local law number 55 for the year 2008.

Items.MatterName: Co-naming of 49  thoroughfares and public places and the renaming of one thoroughfare and to amend the official map of the city of NY accordingly.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the United States Army to permanently discontinue the practice of shooting and experimenting on living pigs for the purpose of training soldiers how to treat critical gunshot wounds.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: United States Army to permanently discontinue the practice of shooting and experimenting on living pigs for the purpose of training soldiers how to treat critical gunshot wounds.

Items.Title: Resolution urging the Federal Communications Commission to deny the petition filed by the CTIA (The Wireless Association) regarding wireless tower siting in relation to state and local zoning laws.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: Urging the Federal Communications Commission to deny the petition filed by the CTIA (The Wireless Association) regarding wireless tower siting in relation to state and local zoning laws.

Items.Title: Resolution declaring a symbolic ban on the negative use of the word “ghetto” in New York City.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Rights
Items.MatterName: Declaring a symbolic ban on the negative use of the word “ghetto” in NYC.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring safety registration numbers.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Application of the NYC construction codes to general contractors, demolition contractors and concrete contractors obtaining safety registration numbers.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to an increase in the rate of the additional tax on the occupancy of hotel rooms imposed by chapter 25 of title 11 of such code.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: An increase in the rate of the additional tax on the occupancy of hotel rooms imposed by chapter 25 of title 11 of such code.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to displaying a passengers’ bill of rights in taxicabs and liveries.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Displaying a passengers’ bill of rights in for-hire vehicles.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the implementation of technology to allow traffic enforcement agents to issue idling tickets through their hand-held computers.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Requiring the implementation of technology to allow traffic enforcement agents to issue idling tickets through their hand-held computers.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of health and mental hygiene to issue an annual report regarding hepatitis B.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Requiring the department of health and mental hygiene to issue an annual report regarding hepatitis B.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the J-51 tax abatement and exemption program.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: J-51 tax abatement and exemption program.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the prohibition of the retail sale and distribution of novelty lighters.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: Prohibition of the retail sale and distribution of novelty lighters.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the City of New York, in relation to requiring the Fire Commissioner to send certain reports to the City Council.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: Requiring the Fire Commissioner to send certain reports to the City Council.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign legislation amending the Public Housing Law to forgo Payments in Lieu of Taxes on New York City Housing Authority City and State projects.

Items.MatterName: Amending the Public Housing Law to forgo Payments in Lieu of Taxes on NYC Housing Authority City and State projects.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring photographs to be included with certain notices of violation for parking violations.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Requiring traffic agents to photograph all ticketable offenses and include a copy of the photograph with each notice of violation.

Items.Title: A Local Law to provide for the levy and collection of additional real property taxes for fiscal year 2009, and to amend the administrative code of the city of New York and the New York City charter in relation to the date when taxes are due and payable.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Provide for the levy and collection of additional real property taxes for FY'09.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the participation of minority-and women-owned business enterprises in construction projects related to properties receiving tax benefits in accordance with the industrial and commercial abatement program.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to responsibilities of entities commencing action to recover real property in foreclosure actions.

Items.MatterName: Responsibilities of entities commencing action to recover real property in foreclosure actions.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign into law S.1182 and A.5358, which require the holder of a mortgage who prevails in a foreclosure proceeding to maintain the property involved in the foreclosure action in a safe and habitable condition until it is disposed of.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Require the holder of a mortgage who prevails in a foreclosure proceeding to maintain the foreclosed property in a safe and habitable condition until it is disposed of.
